newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Asia infrastructure to fuel Forte growth.
newsitem.headline: Asia infrastructure to fuel Forte growth.

text.p: U.S. company Forte Software Inc said on Thursday that infrastructure spending growth in Asia would fuel future demand for its products in the region.

"In three years, I would expect to get four to five percent of worldwide revenue...from Southeast Asia alone, exclusive of Japan, exclusive of Australia. It would be relatively strong due to infrastructure spending that is happening here," George Billman, Forte's director of Asian operations told reporters.
Forte officials were in Singapore to discuss its new Forte Release 3.0 software and its progress in Asia.

The company provides software for development and management of high-end client-server applications. Asia needs such software for complex applications in its infrastructure development, especially in the telecommunications and transport sectors.
Billman said Asia-Pacific accounted for about 12 percent of the company's worldwide revenue and this should rise to 25-30 percent in the next three to four years.
Forte is targetting business outside the United States to contribute more than 50 percent of its worldwide revenue in three to four years time.
For the four quarters ended September 1996, Forte recorded a revenue of US$45.7 million compared to US$17.6 million for the same period the year before.
In Asia, Forte was focusing on partnerships with about 20 systems integrators, Billman said. "I'd like to see that double by this time next year," he said.
